title: Context API Deep Dive
subject: React
theory:
## Optimizing Context
A large single Context causes performance issues because ANY change re-renders ALL consumers.

### Split Context Pattern
Instead of `<UserContext value={{ user, setUser }}>`, split it into:
1. `UserValueContext` (Holds data)
2. `UserDispatchContext` (Holds setters)

Components that only need to *update* data (SubmitButton) won't re-render when data changes.

common_mistakes.correction: `<Provider value={{ user }}>` creates a new object every render, forcing consumers to update. Wrap value in `useMemo`.

exam_notes: Split contexts by domain (Auth, Theme, Data).
summary: Context is powerful but requires discipline to scale without lag.
